channel.title: Max player on a server?
channel.description: Does anyone know how to make it, so I have a limit on the ammount of people joining my server? Like if i wanted it to be 14? how would i do that? Thanks.

item.title: Max player on a server?
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

in client.java, playa.java, playahandler.java, or server.java search for maxplayers and you will find somthing. if you cant find anything then your source did not start with it adn you will have to make it your self

Read full topic

item.title: Max player on a server?
item.dc:creator: @emin3m5236 emin3m5236
item.description:
@emin3m5236 wrote:

[quote=“KiIIer, post:25, topic:140309”][quote author=KiIIer link=topic=192477.msg1732961#msg1732961 date=1188960833]
Open server.java and declare:

public static int maxPlayersL = 0;

also, add this in the run method:

if(maxPlayersL > 19){s.close(); misc.println("["+connectingHost+"] was rejected because there is ["+maxPlayersL+"] on.");}

open client.java and add this in the run method after the try:

server.maxPlayersL += 1;

in the logout method add:

server.maxPlayersL -= 1;

[/quote]

I clearly just gave you a simple answer that you can use…[/quote]

Dosn’t work. And llambo can you shut up? Gosh… grow up kid. And stop talking to me unless your gay or sumthing.

Read full topic

anyways, anyone know how to do it?[/quote]

sure your going to be the “bigger man” and blame people for spamming on a thread which so so clearly spammed yourself. fucker.

item.title: Max player on a server?
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

[quote=“KiIIer, post:12, topic:140309”]Open server.java and declare:

public static int maxPlayersL = 0;

also, add this in the run method:

if(maxPlayersL > 19){s.close(); misc.println("["+connectingHost+"] was rejected because there is ["+maxPlayersL+"] on.");}

open client.java and add this in the run method after the try:

server.maxPlayersL += 1;

in the logout method add:

server.maxPlayersL -= 1;

I clearly just gave you a simple answer that you can use…

Read full topic

item.title: Max player on a server?
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

Open server.java and declare:

public static int maxPlayersL = 0;

also, add this in the run method:

if(maxPlayersL > 19){s.close(); misc.println("["+connectingHost+"] was rejected because there is ["+maxPlayersL+"] on.");}

open client.java and add this in the run method after the try:

server.maxPlayersL += 1;

in the logout method add:

server.maxPlayersL -= 1;

item.title: Max player on a server?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“egor42, post:9, topic:140309”]if(PlayerHandler.playerCount < 21) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has logged in! There is now "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players."; } else if(PlayerHandler.playerCount > 20) { System.out.println("[SERVER FULL]: "+playerName+" cannot log in."); } }
Here -.-[/quote]

l2Java

All that will do is tell everyone that someone logged in when there was more than 20 players. It won’t stop them from logging in…
